ranked_diseases.explanation: FSGS is a primary glomerular disease that commonly presents with proteinuria and progressive chronic kidney disease, matching both key features in this patient.
Common cause of chronic kidney disease in adults, typically presents with proteinuria and progressive renal dysfunction, though often has hematuria as well.
Hereditary nephritis that can present with proteinuria and progressive CKD, though typically has earlier onset and often includes hearing loss and ocular abnormalities.
Primary glomerular disease that commonly presents with nephrotic-range proteinuria and can lead to CKD, particularly common in adults.
X-linked lysosomal storage disorder that can present with proteinuria and progressive CKD, though typically has multisystem involvement including cardiac and neurological features.
Common genetic cause of CKD that can present with proteinuria, though typically has characteristic imaging findings of multiple bilateral renal cysts.
Systemic lupus erythematosus with renal involvement can cause proteinuria and CKD, though typically has other systemic features and positive autoantibodies.
